title: Business & Finance
text:
BNY Mellon is making the leap into the market for bitcoin, a sign of broader acceptance of the once-fringe digital currency.

---

Disney again showed how Covid-19 has hit its bottom line, but the company eked out a profit and added over 21 million new Disney+ subscribers in its first quarter.

---

Shell said it would start reducing oil production, calling an end to a decades-old strategy centered on pumping more hydrocarbons.

---

Initial jobless claims, while still high, decreased to 793,000 last week, well below an early January peak that exceeded 900,000.

---

Apollo-owned LifePoint is in talks to buy hospital operator Ardent.

---

The S&P 500 and Nasdaq closed at records, gaining 0.2% and 0.4%, respectively. The Dow slipped 0.02%.

---

Shares of Bumble, an online-dating company, rose 64% in their trading debut.

---

Alden Global Capital , the largest shareholder in Tribune Publishing , is in talks to buy the newspaper chain.

---

PepsiCo projected a gradual rebound in its soda business and expects growth in its food business to endure.

---

Kraft Heinz said comparable sales rose 8% in the U.S. in the fourth quarter.
